thread.title: The Moorside viewers 'feel sorry' for Karen Matthews: 'Did she have learning difficulties?'
thread.title_full: The Moorside viewers 'feel sorry' for Karen Matthews: 'Did she have learning difficulties?'

author: Nicola Agius
title: The Moorside viewers 'feel sorry' for Karen Matthews: 'Did she have learning difficulties?'
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Moorside left viewers torn over Karen Matthews tonight. 
While some were quick to blast the mother - played by Gemma Whelan - for kidnapping, drugging and imprisoning her own daughter Shannon Matthews , others confessed they felt sorry for her. 
Those tuning in at home couldn't help but notice the portrayal of the character suggested that Karen wasn't perhaps as evil as they previously thought. 
"I get that perhaps Karen has special needs. bit slow. naive and stupid. Doesn't excuse her behaviour or knowing right from wrong #Moorside," one explained on Twitter. Moorside left viewers torn over Karen Matthews 
Another then posted: "R u still my friend? Shows Karen functions as a child.I feel sorry 4 her. Now they're hanging Julie out 2 dry #Moorside." Read More Inside the house of horrors where Shannon Matthews was held captive tethered to a bed for 24 days 
Shortly afterwards, a different viewer wrote: "If this is a true portrayal of Karen Matthews she seemed quite child-like and naive. Equally tragic and disturbing. #Moorside." 
Moments later, another wrote: "If the portrayal of Karen Matthews is accurate she's clearly very damaged, child like, vulnerable, learning difficulties #Moorside." 
In reality, Karen does not suffer with learning disabilities. 
However, it was pointed out in the hour-long episode that she was dealing with the trauma of being sexually abused since her childhood. Karen and her accomplice Michael Donovan were sentenced to eight year's imprisonment (Photo: PA) 
Karen's accomplice in the kidnapping Michael Donovan did have learning difficulties though and half the average IQ. 
In court, both were both found guilty of kidnapping, false imprisonment and perverting the course of justice and were sentenced to eight year's imprisonment. 
Karen was released on licence in April 2012.+ Like us on Facebook
